Class EntryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • EntryManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EntryManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Acts as an MVC model that contains the state data, including entries and users. Is Serializable in order to enable state saving to file.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntryManager

        public EntryManager()
        Constructor for EntryManager. Initializes two empty ArrayLists that hold all saved entries and users.

      • getUserById

        public User getUserById(int id)
        Gets the User that has a given id.
        Parameters:
        id - id to search for
        Returns:
        User with given id, or null if no user was found

      • createEntry

        public Entry createEntry(java.lang.String content,
                         User author,
                         int id,
                         java.sql.Timestamp modificationDate,
                         java.sql.Timestamp creationDate)
        Creates an entry and appends it to the ArrayList. This method takes all attributes of Entry, and thus, is only called by DatabaseIO when restoring state from the database.
        Parameters:
        content - content of the entry
        author - author (User) of the entry
        id - id of the entry (for use in database)
        modificationDate - modification date of the entry
        creationDate - creation date of the entry
        Returns:
        the newly created Entry

      • createEntry

        public Entry createEntry(java.lang.String content,
                         User author)
        Creates an entry and appends it to the ArrayList. Uses a random id, and the current time as modification date and creation date.
        Parameters:
        content - content of the entry
        author - author of the entry
        Returns:
        the newly created Entry

      • createUser

        public User createUser(java.lang.String name,
                       int id)
        Creates a user and appends it to the ArrayList. This method takes all attributes of Entry, and thus, is only called by DatabaseIO when restoring state from the database.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the user
        id - id of the user
        Returns:
        the newly created User

      • createUser

        public User createUser(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a user and appends it to the ArrayList. Uses a random id.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the user
        Returns:
        the newly created User
